content:
• Wednesday, June 13, 2018
  • EVLV

    Evine Live +6.8% as CFO discloses share purchase

    • Evine Live (NASDAQ:EVLV) is up 6.8% after hours following an SEC filing indicating its chief financial officer bought 5,000 shares.
    • Diana Purcel, executive VP and CFO, bought the shares on Monday at an average price of $1.2064 each.
    • That brings her holdings to 55,000 shares, according to the filing.
    • Shares had fallen 2.5% during the regular market session.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:46 PM
  • TLGT

    After Hours Gainers / Losers (06/13/2018)

    • Top gainers: TLGT +11.6%. KRP +4.1%. WUBA +3.4%. CATM +2.9%. OZM +2.7%.
    • Top Losers: TLRD -21.0%. MYL -4.5%.  RDNT -3.1%. QURE -2.1%. EIGI -2.1%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:35 PM
  • MYL

    Mylan down 4% after hours on expected CRL for generic Advair Diskus application

    • Mylan N.V. (NASDAQ:MYL) slips 4% after hours on its disclosure that it will receive a CRL regarding its pending marketing application for a generic version of GlaxoSmithKline's (NYSE:GSK) asthma med Advair Diskus (fluticasone propionate 250 mcg and salmeterol 50 mcg inhalation powder).
    • The company says the FDA informed it that it identified minor deficiencies in the application. It will assess the impact from the situation on 2018 guidance after it reviews the CRL.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:57 PM | 9 Comments
  • TLGT

    FDA OKs Teligent's generic diflorasone diacetate ointment; shares up 10% after hours

    • Teligent (NASDAQ:TLGT) is up 10% after hours in response to the FDA approval of its generic Diflorasone Diacetate Ointment 0.05%. Per IQVIA, the U.S. market is ~$14M.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:49 PM
  • T

    Vanity Fair: Zucker staying at CNN through '20 election

    • A favorite punching bag of President Trump isn't going anywhere for a while: Jeff Zucker will stay at the helm of CNN through the 2020 election, firming up one piece of the post-AT&T Time Warner regime, Vanity Fair reports.
    • Zucker signed a deal months ago, according to the report. For those looking for the drama in any business story, it's quite a turnabout from the very recent prospect that AT&T (NYSE:T) would be denied an acquisition of Time Warner (NYSE:TWX) without selling CNN entirely.
    • The move erases one of the big question marks about who would sail on with the soon-to-be-combined media/telecom giant.
    • Zucker was Trump's boss when he ran NBC during the salad days of Trump's reality competition The Apprentice. ("I made Jeff Zucker," Trump has reportedly said.)
    • AT&T executives were made aware of Zucker's retention deal at the time it was made, and they were supportive, Joe Pompeo reports.
    • AT&T fell 6.2% during the regular session today; it's up 0.1% after hours. TWX rose 1.8% during market hours and is up 0.2% postmarket.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:41 PM | 52 Comments
  • AQMS

    Aqua Metals -10% after announcing share offering

    • Aqua Metals (NASDAQ:AQMS) -9.8% after-hours on news it plans a public offering of an unspecified number of common shares.
    • AQMS says it plans to use the proceeds for working capital, which could include capex related to addressing operational efficiencies and the expansion of production activities at its initial AquaRefining facility in Nevada, as well as general corporate purposes.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:34 PM | 3 Comments
  • TOL

    Fed day proves a rough one for homebuilders

    • The homebuilders were under pressure all day long and added to losses following the Fed's 25 basis point rate hike and signal that two more moves were coming before year-end.
    • The 10-year yield briefly surged back above 3%, but settled up just one basis point at 2.975%.
    • The iShares U.S. Home Construction ETF (ITB -3.7%).
    • Individual players: Toll Brothers (TOL -4.3%), Pulte (PHM -6.7%), D.R. Horton (DHI -4.2%), KB Home (KBH -7.3%), Lennar (LEN -4%)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:25 PM | 5 Comments
  • HBIO

    Harvard Bio launches new inhalation and exposure system; shares up 1% after hours

    • Harvard Bioscience (NASDAQ:HBIO) announces that subsidiary Data Sciences International has launched a new inhalation and exposure system, the DSI Buxco.
    • The company says the system enables researchers to perform accurate real-time respiration monitoring during exposure via its FinePoint software.
    • The market for inhaled drugs is ~$48B.
    • Shares are up 1% after hours.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:09 PM
  • IVR

    Mortgage REITs in the red as Fed signals two more rate hikes

    • The Fed boosted rates 25 basis points earlier - no surprise there. Somewhat surprising though, were the "dots," which now indicate the Fed's median expectation as being for two more moves this year. That would be four total for 2018 vs. the three that had been previously anticipated.
    • Among mortgage REITs (REM -0.5%) Invesco Mortgage (IVR -1.4%), Annaly Capital (NLY -0.9%), Armour Residential (ARR -0.6%), AGNC Investment (AGNC -0.7%), Dynex Capital (DX -1%), Two Harbors (TWO -1%), Western Asset (WMC -0.9%)
    • ETFs: MORL, REM, MORT
     
     
     
     
    | 4:05 PM | 74 Comments
  • CMCSA

    Comcast unveils $65B cash bid for Fox assets, setting up Disney war

    • With the market closing and AT&T's Time Warner victory still hot from the oven, Comcast (NASDAQ:CMCSA) has unveiled its bid for the media assets of Twenty-First Century Fox (FOX, FOXA).
    • It's a total bid of $65B, $35/share in cash, a premium of about 19% to Disney's offer.
    • Disney (NYSE:DIS) has a stock deal for the entertainment assets worth about $52.4B, and all signs point to a bidding war, with the prospect of Fox's IP being a must-have in the consolidated media/telecom future.
    • It's a bid intended to move the needle on Fox, which reportedly spurned a similarly higher bid from Comcast before with Rupert Murdoch preferring the tax-free transfer of Disney stock instead. The size of this bid might change his mind, or at least put the fear of that outcome into Disney.
    • After hours: CMCSA +0.5%; DIS flat; FOX +0.6%; FOXA +0.7%. During the regular session, FOX gained 7.5%; FOXA gained 7.8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:01 PM | 72 Comments
  • TREE

    Lending Tree drops as analyst sees near-term choppiness in mortgage business

    • LendingTree (NASDAQ:TREE) -7.7% in late afternoon trading after an analyst writes that he's "slightly less optimistic about near-term growth trend in mortgage," Bloomberg reports, citing a note by analyst Stephen Sheldon.
    • TREE's mortgage business should improve in 2019, Sheldon says.
    • Converting purchase leads has been more difficult and taking longer than converting refinancing leads, management said at the recent Blair conference.
    • TREE has 9 buys, 3 holds, 1 sell; average price target $335: Bloomberg data.
    • Previously: LendingTree to buy credit service firm for $20.75M (May 11)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:50 PM | 11 Comments
  • HEAR

    Turtle Beach rallies on, +11.7% as Oppenheimer stays bullish

    • Turtle Beach's (NASDAQ:HEAR) hot spring continues, with an 11.7% gain today after Oppenheimer reiterates an Outperform rating based on meeting management at E3.
    • CEO Juergen Stark and CFO John Hanson met with analyst Andrew Uerkwitz and pointed to its improving balance sheet and strong position in the market for console headsets. Product quality will allow it to maintain a highly defensible lead over rivals, the two said. (h/t Bloomberg)
    • Shares are up 222% in just over two months, but are the S&P Total Market leader in YTD percentage gains with 10-bagger performance (the stock started the year at $1.81/share and today sits at $22.38).
    • Uerkwitz and team may need to update a price target of $12 (which had been boosted to that point from $4 on May 10, just before a sharp leg up in the stock's performance).
     
     
     
     
    | 3:42 PM | 5 Comments
  • ACAD

    Acadia Pharma down 9%

    • ACADIA Pharmaceuticals (ACAD -8.8%) slumps almost 40% higher volume following its corporate presentation at the Goldman Sachs Healthcare Conference.
    • Shares have been mired in a nine-month downtrend with shares shedding about 60% of their value. Abrupt selloffs occurred in February, in response to below-consensus sales of NUPLAZID (pimavanserin) in Q4, and April in reaction to the news that the FDA was re-examining safety data related to the Parkinson's disease psychosis med.
    • Previously: Acadia Pharma down 17% premarket on Nuplazid safety concerns (April 9)
    • Previously: ACADIA down 17% after Q4 Nuplazid sales disappoint (Feb. 28)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:36 PM | 62 Comments
  • MACK

    Merrimack Pharma breaks free of consolidation, up 10%

    • Thinly traded micro cap Merrimack Pharmaceuticals (MACK +9.6%) is up on almost a 9x surge in volume, although shares have retraced 9% from the intraday high of $10.53.
    • No particular news accounts for the action. Upcoming catalysts are data readouts from Phase 2 studies of MM-121 (seribantumab) in heregulin-positive non-small cell lung cancer and breast cancer.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:19 PM | 5 Comments
  • TRHC

    Tabula Rasa closes medication management contract with PACE program; shares up 4%

    • Tabula Rasa (TRHC +4.2%) is up on below-average volume on the news that subsidiary CareKinesis has closed a contract with St. Bernards Total Life Healthcare, an Arkansas-based PACE program, to provide comprehensive medication management services. Financial terms are not disclosed.
    • PACE (Program for All-inclusive Care for the Elderly) is a Medicare and Medicaid benefit for people at least 55 years old who are nursing home eligible. Its aim is to reduce emergency room visits and hospitalizations by keeping participants living in their homes while receiving care.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:02 PM
  • PVTL

    Technology - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 2.55 PM (06/13/2018)

    • Gainers: PVTL +34%. ENPH +32%. AGMH +12%. HEAR +10%. APPN +10%.
    • Losers: MOXC -24%. APPS -13%. SAIC -8%. SE -7%. GRVY -7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:57 PM

  • Emerging markets lower after hawkish Fed

    • They're not down by a ton today, but both the Vanguard FTSE Emerging Markets ETF (VWO -0.9%) and the iShares MSCI Emerging Markets ETF (EEM -0.9%) suffered notable dips just after 2 ET, when the FOMC not just hiked rates by 25 basis points, but signaled it's ready to move two more times this year.
    • Prior to that, markets had been undecided on whether we were going to get one or three or four rate hikes in 2018.
    • Emerging market debt (EMB -0.5%) also slid as the news hit.
    • ETFs: EEM, VWO, IEMG, EDC, SCHE, EDZ, EMF, MSF, ADRE, EEV, EUM, EET, SPEM, EEME, XSOE, DBEM, FEM, HEEM, EWEM, ROAM, ESGE, EDBI, EMLB
     
     
     
     
    | 2:45 PM

  • Dollar on the move after Fed signals two more hikes this year

    • Nicely lower minutes ago, the dollar index (UUP, UDN) is in the green after the FOMC - as expected - jacked rates by 25 basis points for the 2nd time this year.
    • The big question, though, was three hikes or four hikes in 2018? Checking the dots in the  updated economic projections, the median forecast now calls for an end-of-year Fed Funds rate of about 2.5% - meaning two more moves this year.
    • Gold (NYSEARCA:GLD) is also moving, but pretty modestly. It's dropped about $4 per ounce since the announcement, now off 0.1% for the day.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:29 PM | 10 Comments
  • EDR

    Education Realty Trust in sale talks with Greystar - WSJ

    • According to the report, the P-E player has offered $41.50 per share for Education Realty Trust (NYSE:EDR).
    • Shares are up 0.7% to $40.38, but were trading at about $36 prior to a June 1 report about a possible sale.
    • Previously: Sudden jump for Education Realty Trust (June 1)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:24 PM
  • EXK

    Energy/Materials - Top Gainers / Losers as of 2:00 PM (06/13/2018)

    • Gainers: EXK +7%. LXU +5%. PDS +5%. ROSE +5%.
    • Losers: USAC -9%. VHI -7%. MCEP -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:00 PM
  • VSAT

    ViaSat shores up UK military presence with Horsebridge purchase

    • ViaSat (VSAT +1.9%) has acquired UK-based secure networking firm Horsebridge Defence and Security.
    • Financial terms weren't disclosed. ViaSat hasn't fully evaluated the acquisition's impact to GAAP earnings.
    • The company says the add-on enhances military communications integration expertise, allowing for growth the UK defense market.
    • Horsebridge has built strong relationships with the UK Armed Forces and supports a number of their programs.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:29 PM
  • CRSP

    CRISPR Therapeutics GS presentation fails to excite investors, shares down 7%

    • CRISPR Therapeutics (CRSP -6.9%) slumps on more than 40% higher volume following its corporate presentation at Goldman Sachs' Healthcare Conference. Investors are behaving like they were disappointed with what was said.
    • CRISPR/Cas9 competitors Intellia Therapeutics (NTLA +1.8%) and Editas Medicine (EDIT +1.8%) are holding their own.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:15 PM | 25 Comments
  • BA

    Boeing slips 1% on report of possible order cancellation

    • Amid a review of its fleet plans after suffering almost a $2B loss a couple of years back, Etihad Airways is mulling the cancellation or deferment of billions of dollars of 777X orders, according to Reuters.
    • The company, according to the report, would be willing to pay penalties rather than face overcapacity.
    • BA -1.2%
     
     
     
     
    | 1:06 PM | 45 Comments
  • YRIV

    Financials - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 1:00 PM (06/13/2018)

    • Gainers: YRIV +8%. MFNC +6%. SIEB +6%. QIWI +5%. BCRH +5%.
    • Losers: HGSH -10%. TREE -7%. CIFS -6%. GROW -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:01 PM
  • NFLX

    Netflix clarifies gaming plans

    • Netflix (NFLX +4.4%) says it's producing an interactive Minecraft series for kids and licensing Stranger Things for a video game. The company's disclosure falls far short of a TechRadar exclusive in which sources said the company is prepping to add games to its subscription service.
    • Shares of GameStop (GME -4.3%) have tracked back a bit after the Netflix update. It's still possible that longer term plans are in the works at Netflix to integrate games.
    • Previously: Gaming plans from Netflix send GameStop lower (June 13)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:52 PM | 32 Comments
  • ENPH

    Midday Gainers / Losers (06/13/2018)

    • Gainers: ENPH +33%. PVTL +27%. OTC:SEII +20%. GALT +15%. KFY +13%. SHLD +12%. HEAR +11%. COOL +11%. HEBT +10%. KNDI +9%.
    • Losers: FLKS -68%. MOXC -24%. SCPH -22%. HRB -18%. VTVT -13%. TAL -12%. GRVY -12%. HGSH -10%. USAC -9%. APPS -9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM | 6 Comments
  • ATVI

    Videogame publishers dip momentarily on Netflix game news

    • A sudden downblip in the big videogame publishers righted itself almost instantly in the wake of a report that Netflix is planning to add games to its streaming service. (Netflix has clarified that it's adding an "interactive series" around Minecraft and is developing one based on Stranger Things, which looks like story-mode video rather than typical console games.)
    • Activision Blizzard (NASDAQ:ATVI), Electronic Arts (NASDAQ:EA) and Take-Two Interactive Software (NASDAQ:TTWO) all took a multi-percentage point drop about 25 minutes ago alongside the news, before an instant recovery; algorithmic trading is a likely culprit in the brief volume spike.
    • With E3 under way, all three are now higher to significantly higher on the day: ATVI +0.8%; EA +2.6%; TTWO +2.3%. Other publishers are gaining as well: OTCPK:UBSFY +1.7%; ZNGA +1.1%; GLUU +4.1%. The PureFunds Video Game Tech ETF, GAMR, is down 0.5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:37 PM | 12 Comments
  • GALT

    Galectin adds to rally, up 15%

    • MIcro cap Galectin Therapeutics (GALT +14.5%) continues its northward march on more than a 5x surge in volume. Shares have more than doubled since mid-May when it announced its plan to advance NASH candidate GR-MD-02 into Phase 3 development.
    • Previously: Galectin to advance NASH candidate GR-MD-02 into Phase 3 (May 14)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:37 PM | 34 Comments
  • NFLX

    Gaming plans from Netflix send GameStop lower

    • Netflix (NFLX +4.4%) plans to add games to its service, including a version of Minecraft and a game with a Stranger Things theme, according to a TechRadar exclusive.
    • Sources indicate that the games will be delivered through video files and be controlled by a remote equipped with gaming buttons.
    • Netflix will partner with Telltale Games on the project.
    • Shares of Gamestop (NYSE:GME) are down 5.20% in what could be reaction to the Netflix gaming development.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:20 PM | 53 Comments
  • SYK

    Madrigal Pharma up 6% on takeover chatter

    • Takeover rumor mongerers have moved from Stryker (SYK +2.7%) and Boston Scientific (BSX -5.2%) to Madrigal Pharmaceuticals (MDGL +6.4%), up on almost double normal volume.
    • Two weeks ago, shares jumped after the company announced positive data on NASH candidate MGL-3196.
    • Previously: Madrigal's MGL-3196 shows sustained benefit in mid-stage NASH study; shares up 40% premarket (May 31)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:14 PM | 2 Comments
  • WDC

    Western Digital +1.5% in midday move

    • Western Digital (WDC +1.5%) has legged up on no particular news, hitting a session high of $83.44.
    • That's also its highest point in a week.
    • Shares are still significantly down (about 22%) from their 2018 high of $106.96, hit on March 16.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:07 PM | 8 Comments
  • KNDI

    Consumer - Top Gainers / Losers as of 12:00 PM (06/13/2018)

    • Gainers: KNDI +12%. CRWS +9%. VNCE +8%. KOSS +6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:01 PM
  • PAC

    UBS positive on Grupo Aeroportuario del Pacifico

    • Grupo Aeroportuario del Pacifico (PAC +1.9%) trades higher after UBS upgrades the Mexican airport operator to Outperform from Market Perform.
    • Shares of Grupo are down 15% YTD as trade and tariff concerns have entered the equation.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:43 AM
  • BITA

    Bitauto +11% after easy beat in Q1 earnings

    • Bitauto (NYSE:BITA) is up 11% in NYSE trading in the regular session, after a solid revenue beat and a surprise profit in its Q1 earnings.
    • Non-GAAP net income did tumble to 37.lM yuan (about $5.9M) from a year-ago gain of 156.9M yuan. On a GAAP basis, losses swelled to 288.3M yuan from a year-ago loss of 50.1M yuan.
    • Revenues beat easily after a 52.3% gain in renminbi terms, to 2.17B yuan.
    • Transaction services revenue more than doubled on high volumes to 1.17B yuan. Advertising and subscription revenues rose 16.3% to 787.5M yuan; and digital marketing solutions revenue rose 28.2% to 211.3M yuan.
    • For Q2, it's guiding to revenue of 2.47B-2.52B yuan ($393.8M-$401.7M), a Y/Y increase of 23.8%-26.3% in renminbi terms. That's in ASC 606 terms net of VAT; comparing on a gross basis, it would be 2.66B-2.71B yuan, a 22.5%-24.9% increase.
    • Press release
     
     
     
     
    | 11:42 AM | 1 Comment
  • PULM

    Early-stage study supports value proposition of Pulmatrix's PUR0200; shares ahead 5%

    • Nano cap Pulmatrix (PULM +5.1%) is up on almost triple normal volume in response to results from a Phase 1 clinical trial assessing lead candidate PUR0200 in patients with moderate-to-severe chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD).
    • PUR0200 achieved a similar therapeutic effect to Boehringer Ingelheim's Spiriva HandiHaler (tiotropium bromide) Inhalation Spray at an 83% lower dose with more than 30% less plasma drug exposure.
    • The value proposition of PUR0200, an improved inhaled tiotropium bromide, is enhanced efficacy by virtue of its iSPERSE dry powder technology which travels more easily into the lungs.
    • The company is co-developing PUR0200 with Vectura Group plc (OTCPK:VEGPF) for the U.S. market.
    • Previously: Pulmatrix teams up with Vectura to develop COPD candidate PUR0200; shares down 3% (Sept. 6, 2017)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:40 AM
  • SAIC

    Science Applications slides 6.9% post Q1 results

    • Science Applications (SAIC -6.9%) reports Q1 revenue growth of 7.3% Y/Y to 1.2B, the increase was due to revenue on new contracts primarily supporting NASA and the Environmental Protection Agency $47M and increased orders in our supply chain portfolio $64M.
    • Operating margin declined 10 bps to 5.6% & EBITDA margin declined 10 bps to 6.5%, which was driven by higher supply chain material content which generate lower operating margins.
    • Cash flows provided by operating activities was $88M, this net increase in working capital investments in platform integration programs supporting the U.S. Navy and Marine Corps was offset by strong customer collections in Q1.
    • Deployed $54M of capital, consisting of $32M in plan share repurchases of 0.4M shares, $14M in cash dividends and an $8M term loan repayment.
    • Book-to-bill ratio of 0.8%, estimated backlog of signed business orders was ~$10B of which$1.9 B was funded.
    • Declared a cash dividend of $0.31 per share payable on July 27, 2018.
    • Previously: Science Applications beats by $0.10, beats on revenue (June 12)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:37 AM
  • ENPH

    Enphase Energy +32% as microinverter deal seen boosting revenue, margins

    • Enphase Energy (ENPH +32.1%) explodes higher after yesterday's acquisition of SunPower’s (SPWR +2.7%) microinverter business in a cash and stock deal.
    • ENPH will become the exclusive supplier of microinverters to SPWR, scrapping development of the former SolarBridge products, instead developing a version of its latest platform technology for SPWR’s AC modules.
    • The IQ7 is ENPH's seventh generation microinverter platform, and the IQ 7XS microinverter is said to offer 97.5% CEC efficiency and is designed specifically for SPWR’s X Series 96-cell PV modules, PV Tech explains.
    • ENPH hopes the deal will generate an extra $60M-$70M in annual revenue in H2 2019 vs. $286M in total 2017 revenue and boost margins to 33%-35% vs. 19% in 2017.
    • For SPWR, the deal is part of a two-year restructuring in an attempt to return to profitability after reporting an $850M loss for FY 2017.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:35 AM | 12 Comments
  • TAL

    TAL Education -11% after Muddy Waters attack

    • TAL Education (NYSE:TAL) falls 10.80% after Muddy Waters Research sets its short-selling spotlight on the company.
    • In a nutshell, Muddy Waters alleges that TAL Education has been "fraudulently" overstating profits since FY16.
    • Full Muddy Waters report on TAL.
    • If TAL issues a response to the Muddy Waters attack it will be added to the post.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:23 AM | 22 Comments
  • FOX

    Cramer: AT&T judge sets 'blueprint' for Comcast/media buying spree

    • In his decision on the AT&T case, Judge Richard Leon has laid out the "blueprint" for Comcast (CMCSA -1.3%) to buy media assets from Fox (FOX +7.5%, FOXA +7.5%), Jim Cramer says.
    • And not just Comcast, but for other firms to start merging and buying, with the "ultimate green light" for vertical mergers.
    • Cramer reads the judge's commentary around the decision to be "you can disagree with me but old media better start buying each other quickly because Facebook (FB +0.6%) and Google (GOOG +0.3%, GOOGL +0.3%) are going to crush [you]."
    • He notes the 172-page opinion was a "vicious" rebuke that was an "embarrassment" for the Justice Dept.: "This was brutal."
     
     
     
     
    | 11:22 AM | 39 Comments
  • TBI

    TrueBlue acquires TMP Holdings LTD

    • TrueBlue (TBI +1.8%) has acquired TMP Holdings LTD. Terms of the transaction were not disclosed.
    • TMP is a leading provider of Recruitment Process Outsourcing, resourcing and recruitment marketing services in the UK.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:22 AM
  • HOG

    Harley-Davidson and Polaris on watch

    • Harley-Davidson (HOG +3.1%) and Polaris Industries (PII +1.4%) are on watch after Bloomberg tips that M Science is out with a positive note on the vehicle makers.
    • Harley and Polaris have seen some jittery trading over tariff concerns.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:09 AM
  • LE

    Lands' End -7% as SA contributor warns

    • Lands' End (NASDAQ:LE) is down 6.85% to cut just a bit into what been's a dizzying 90-day rally of over 75%.
    • Seeking Alpha contributor L&F Capital Management was out with a warning late yesterday on Lands' End ahead of today's dip.
    • "Although we understand that the fundamentals supporting LE are strengthening, we also feel that this rally is overdone and that valuation is starting to make no sense at present levels," wrote L&F.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:04 AM
  • SEII

    Sharing Economy jumps 28% on new sharing agreement

    • Sharing Economy International (OTC:SEII +28.2%) announced it entered into a license agreement with Ecrent Capital Holdings, an extensive online global sharing platforms which encourages people to share through renting to protect our environment. The agreement grants of an exclusive and sublicensable license from ECRENT to SEII to utilize certain software and trademarks in order to develop, launch, operate, commercialize, and maintain an online website platform in North Korea.
    • SEII will pay Ecrent a maximum of $1M satisfying the condition precedent that the gross profit generated from the corresponding business arrangement in North Korea exceeds the license fee payment.
    • The agreement expires on December 31, 2023.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:01 AM
  • GALT

    Healthcare - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 11:00 AM (06/13/2018)

    • Gainers: GALT +11%. PLXP +9%. CODX +8%. EOLS +7%. SRRA +7%.
    • Losers: FLKS -67%. SCPH -23%. VTVT -12%. GLMD -8%. VRML -7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:01 AM | 1 Comment
  • POWI

    Power Integrations could gain from Apple design win, analyst says

    • Power Integrations (POWI +3.2%) moves higher in early trading after Rosenblatt analyst Jun Zhang says the company potentially secured a design win for all iPhone and iPad fast charging solutions.
    • Apple's (AAPL +0.1%) demand for the fast charging chipset reportedly would total 300M units/year at $0.50-$0.70 per chipset - a "huge win."
    • POWI would replace ON Semiconductor (ON +1.2%) and NXP Semiconductors (NXPI -1.4%) as the main provider for the charging solution for all new iPhones and iPads, and Zhang says Wall Street estimates likely do not reflect this opportunity.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:55 AM | 6 Comments
  • TACO

    Wedbush expects Del Taco to outperform

    • Wedbush assesses Del Taco (TACO +0.8%) favorably as it keeps an Outperform rating on the restaurant stock and lifts the price target to $17 on an expectation for a second-half acceleration.
    • The investment firm forecasts 2018 system same-store sales growth of 3.8% for Del Taco, which ranks it second behind Domino's of Wedbush estimates for the restaurant sector.
    • Wedbush digging into the details: "We expect Q2’s tough 6.9% co-owned and 7.5% franchised comp comparisons to be anniversaried with a mid-1% co-owned SSS growth rate and a mid-3% franchised SSS growth rate We expect the next step of management’s ‘Elevated Combined Solutions’ to launch in early Q3, with an all-new ad campaign accompanying new menu boards, new employee uniforms, and compelling menu innovation, including one or more items at value price points. We view incremental menu price increases towards 3.5% in Q3 and 4% in Q4 (up from 3% in Q2 and 2.5% in Q1), as incremental SSS growth drivers as well."
    • Shares of Del Taco are up 8.50% YTD.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:53 AM | 1 Comment
  • CRBP

    Corbus Pharma's lenabasum shows positive effect in extension phases of mid-stage trials in rare autoimmune disorders; shares up 1%

    • Results from open-label extensions of Phase 2 clinical trials assessing Corbus Pharmaceuticals' (CRBP +0.8%) lenabasum in patients with systemic sclerosis (SSc) and dermatomyositis (DM) showed sustained treatment benefits. The data are being presented at EULAR in Amsterdam.
    • At year 1, 77% of SSc patients experienced medically meaningful improvements in a measure of skin thickness called modified Rodnan skin score (mRSS).
    • At month 6, 88% of DM patients achieved medically meaningful improvements in a scale called CDASI activity score.
    • On the safety front, no serious/severe treatment-related adverse events were reported. The most common adverse events were upper respiratory tract infection (22%), joint pain, skin ulcer and urinary tract infection (14% each) and diarrhea (11%).
    • Lenabasum, an oral synthetic endocannabinoid-mimetic, has Orphan Drug and Fast Track status in the U.S. for SSc and Orphan Drug status in Europe for the indication. It is currently being evaluated in a Phase 3 study, RESOLVE-1, with an estimated completion date of March 2020.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:48 AM

    • Thinly traded nano cap Flex Pharma (NASDAQ:FLKS) craters 61% premarket on average volume in response to its announcement that it has terminated its Phase 2 clinical trials evaluating lead drug FLX-787 in amyotrophic lateral sclerosis (ALS) and Charcot-Marie-Tooth (CMT) due to oral tolerability concerns in a subset of patients who received the 30 mg oral disintegrating tablet three times per day.
